story_ch0064_00_rival_05_01000/2401_1201: Oh, [Name:PlayerNickname ]...
Have you seen Paulo?

Ever since we lost to Team Rocket, Paulo’s been
acting weird.
Like he’s cornered or something.

I think something that happened when we were
little has been bothering him...
Would you mind telling me what happened?
Colress...

Oh! I completely forgot I was supposed to be your
bodyguard! Sorry about that!
It’s nothing to worry about.

More importantly, what happened back when
you were young?
Oh, right. Well...

It happened back when Paulo and I weren’t even
Trainers yet.

There was this wild Dratini we were secretly
taking care of, and...
Yaaay! We got to play with you so much today!
We’ll bring you more food again later, OK?
I wanna be a Trainer already...

I wanna go on a journey with Dratini and
challenge the Champion!

No way! I’M the one who’s gonna travel
with Dratini!
Nuh-uh! It’s gonna be me!
Who says?
Dratini?!
What’re you doing, mister?!
Isn’t it obvious? I’m catching this Pokémon!
Cut it out! That Dratini is one that we—

What a Trainer does with wild Pokémon is none
of your business!
Take it down, Golbat!
Now!
How could you...
Hahaha! Gotcha!
Hey, hold on!
Please... Take good care of that Dratini.
Pffft. Don’t be silly.

Dratini are tricky to raise. Like I’d waste my time
carefully pampering it.
Then why did you even—

Let me teach you something, kid. The skins Dratini
shed can be sold for good money.
With one in hand, I could be rich!
You only caught it for the money?!

Hmph. If you’ve got a problem with that, you’ll
have to stop me yourself—with force!

Not like you can do that anyway. You scrawny
runts aren’t even Trainers yet!
Waaaaaaaaah!
Waaaah! Waaaah!
C’mon, stop crying...
B-but...
Let’s get stronger.
Huh?
He’s right. Let’s get stronger, Tina.
So that we never, ever...
have to lose anything important to us again.
Since then, we got older.

Paulo and I got our Pokémon and left the town
where we grew up.
But I think that incident still hurts him to this day.
I see. But that raises a question.

Why didn’t you, like Paulo, develop a fixation on
becoming stronger to protect others?

I do think that the strength to protect things
is important.

And I don’t want to say good-bye like that
ever again.
But...

I know that the time I can spend with my
Pokémon is limited, so I want us to spend it
together, making all sorts of memories.
Once, on my travels, I saw a Pokémon graveyard.

Some Trainers who came to visit graves told
me their stories. That’s when I started to think
this way.

There’s no point in getting strong if it means you
forget about the connection you have with
your Pokémon.

That’s why I don’t like how Paulo’s been
thinking lately.

He can’t be as strong as he wants, and that’s
really weighing on his mind...
[Name:PlayerNickname ]! Colress!
I don’t think Paulo’s gonna listen to me anymore.

He didn’t even try to listen to what Blue and
Cheren were telling him, either.
So...I need your help—to save him!
story_ch0064_00_rival_05_01000/2401_0401:
I’m curious to see how my scientific methods can
help you achieve your goals!
story_ch0064_00_rival_05_01000/2401_0402:
Indeed it is! I’m curious to see how my scientific
methods can help you achieve your goals!
story_ch0064_00_rival_05_01000/2401_1201: Thank you, both!
This is just my opinion as a researcher, but...

Pursuing victory and cherishing memories together
are both important.

That’s why you mustn’t get too caught up in one
or the other!

Maintaining a neutral view of matters is what
draws out potential!
OK!
